Description: 1 ear-ring and 81 beads made in different shapes and materials: A: One fragment of an ear-ring made of white faience, roughly triangular in section but very flat. B: Fragment of a spacer-bead made of white faience, two segments preserved, a third visible, flat. C: A raw bead, cylindrical in shape, roughly carved but not smoothed, the perforation broke through the outer surface. Another hint for bead production on site. D: Three elongated cylindrical beads, made of white faience. E: Three flattened spherical beads, made of white faience. F: One and a half ring-shaped beads, made of corroded glass, pearlescent in colour. G: 11 middle-sized disc-shaped beads, one made of ostrich eggshell, one made of turquoise faience, the rest made of white faience. H: 39 small disc-shaped beads, one made of red faience, four made of white faience, the rest made of beige faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.8, between levels 1 - 2
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
